author: The Telegraph
title: Voltarol prize draw: terms and conditions
text: 1. This prize draw is open to residents of the UK, Channel Islands, Isle of Man and Republic of Ireland aged 18 years or over, except employees of Telegraph Media Group Limited and its group companies, and Novartis Consumer Health UK Limited (trading as Voltarol), their families, agents or anyone else professionally associated with the draw. 2. Details of how to enter form part of the terms and conditions. It is a condition of entry that all rules are accepted as final and that the competitor agrees to abide by these rules. The decision of the judges is final and no correspondence will be entered into. 3. To enter this prize draw, entrants must answer the published question and submit their answer at www.telegraph.co.uk/whynot . Entry is restricted to one per person. Once submitted, entries cannot be amended in any way. 4. Late, illegible, incomplete, defaced or corrupt entries or entries sent through agencies and third parties will not be accepted. No responsibility can be accepted for lost entries and proof of despatch will not be accepted as proof of receipt. The winner will be the first correct entry drawn at random from all entries received by the closing date. The winner’s name and county can be obtained by sending a sae to Why Not – Barcelona Prize Draw Winner, SPARK, Telegraph Media Group, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT within one month after the closing date of the prize draw. 5. All entries must be received by midnight on Sunday, July 26, 2015. 6. The winner will be contacted by the Promoter by telephone or email within 14 days of the closing date of the prize draw. Should the Promoter be unable to contact the winner or should the winner be unable to accept the prize, the Promoter reserves the right to award the prize to an alternative winner, drawn in accordance with these terms and conditions. 7. The prize as described is available on the date of publication. Should the prize become unavailable, a substitute of equal value will be provided. 8. One winning entrant will win a two-night short break for two to Barcelona to try wakeboarding. The prize package comprises: • Two return economy class flights to Barcelona flying from the airport nearest to the winner’s home with flight availability; • Private transfers between the airport and the hotel; • Two nights accommodation in a minimum 3-star hotel, based on two people sharing a twin or double room; • Breakfast on both mornings; and • A 30-minute wakeboarding session for two, including all equipment, a safety briefing and instruction. 9. The prize must be taken as one package. 10. The prize does not include transport to or from the event, travel insurance, personal expenditure or incidental costs. It is the responsibility of the prizewinner to ensure they have a valid passport and travel insurance and obtain any necessary vaccinations and visas for their trip. 11. The prize is valid for travel from March to November and all travel must be completed before November 30, 2016. The prize excludes Easter and bank holidays. All elements of the prize are subject to availability, non transferable and there are no cash alternatives. 12. The winner may be required to participate in reasonable publicity on behalf of the Promoter and Voltarol. 13. Entrants’ data will be used for the purpose of administration of this prize draw and in accordance with the permissions granted or withheld at the point of entry. 14. Events may occur that render the prize draw itself or the awarding of the prize impossible due to reasons beyond the control of the Promoter and accordingly the Promoter may at its absolute discretion vary or amend the promotion and the entrant agrees that no liability shall attach to the Promoter as a result thereof. 15. The Telegraph is responsible for the first part of the promotion, which is the publication and adjudication of the prize draw. All other facilities connected with the provision of the prize are the responsibility of NDL Group on behalf of the Promoter. 16. These Terms and Conditions are to be interpreted in accordance with English law and any dispute arising out of these Terms or their subject matter is subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the English Courts. Promoter: Telegraph Media Group Limited, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT.
